projects.name: Media Forensics Hub
projects.summary: The Media Forensics Hub is an interdisciplinary team of researchers working to study and combat online deception with the goal of building society's resilience to the dangers it poses. The team began as a partnership in 2017 between Darren Linvill, professor of communication, and Patrick Warren, associate professor of economics, who worked together to uncover and expose more than 3 million tweets by Russian trolls. The Media Forensics Hub was launched in May 2020 with the support of the Watt Family Innovation Center and sponsorship from the South Carolina Research Authority. Since then, the Hub has created the Spot the Troll quiz, where people can test their own ability to spot online trolls and inauthentic social media accounts. They are also part of a collaboration with several other universities to help fight online scams that target older adults. That project received $5 million in funding from the National Science Foundation.
